Import hex map coordinates

get_coordinates.Rd

Import hex map coordinates

Usage

get_coordinates(map = NULL, coords = "hexmap")

Arguments

map

A character string specifying which map. Current options are "states50" (50 US States only), "statesDC" (50 states and DC), "statesTerr" (50 states, DC, Puerto Rico, Virgin Islands, Guam, American Samoa, and Marshall Islands), "WIOAETA" (WIOA ETA geographies, same as statesTerr with the addition of Palau), and "WIOAETARegions" (unified maps of WIOA ETA regions) .

coords

A character string specifying "hexmap" for the hexagon coordinates or "labels" for the label coordinates for the hex map

Value

sf object for map, either the hexagons (polygon) or labels (point).

Examples

get_coordinates(map = "states50", coords = "hexmap")
#> Simple feature collection with 50 features and 6 fields
#> Geometry type: POLYGON
#> Dimension:     XY
#> Bounding box:  xmin: 0.8845727 ymin: -250 xmax: 433.8973 ymax: 0
#> CRS:           NA
#> First 10 features:
#>    abbr_usps abbr_gpo abbr_ap        name fips geo_type
#> 1         AK   Alaska  Alaska      Alaska   02    state
#> 2         AL     Ala.    Ala.     Alabama   01    state
#> 3         AR     Ark.    Ark.    Arkansas   05    state
#> 4         AZ    Ariz.   Ariz.     Arizona   04    state
#> 5         CA   Calif.  Calif.  California   06    state
#> 6         CO    Colo.   Colo.    Colorado   08    state
#> 7         CT    Conn.   Conn. Connecticut   09    state
#> 8         DE     Del.    Del.    Delaware   10    state
#> 9         FL     Fla.    Fla.     Florida   12    state
#> 10        GA      Ga.     Ga.     Georgia   13    state
#>                          geometry
#> 1  POLYGON ((35.52559 0, 52.84...
#> 2  POLYGON ((278.0127 -180, 29...
#> 3  POLYGON ((226.0512 -150, 24...
#> 4  POLYGON ((139.4486 -180, 15...
#> 5  POLYGON ((87.48711 -150, 10...
#> 6  POLYGON ((139.4486 -120, 15...
#> 7  POLYGON ((399.2563 -90, 416...
#> 8  POLYGON ((381.9357 -120, 39...
#> 9  POLYGON ((295.3332 -210, 31...
#> 10 POLYGON ((312.6537 -180, 32...
get_coordinates(map = "states50", coords = "labels")
#> Simple feature collection with 50 features and 6 fields
#> Geometry type: POINT
#> Dimension:     XY
#> Bounding box:  xmin: 18.20508 ymin: -230 xmax: 416.5768 ymax: -20
#> CRS:           NA
#> First 10 features:
#>    abbr_usps abbr_gpo abbr_ap        name fips geo_type              geometry
#> 1         AK   Alaska  Alaska      Alaska   02    state  POINT (35.52559 -20)
#> 2         AL     Ala.    Ala.     Alabama   01    state POINT (278.0127 -200)
#> 3         AR     Ark.    Ark.    Arkansas   05    state POINT (226.0512 -170)
#> 4         AZ    Ariz.   Ariz.     Arizona   04    state POINT (139.4486 -200)
#> 5         CA   Calif.  Calif.  California   06    state POINT (87.48711 -170)
